elements.description:
`<catalyst-flip-button>` is a wrapper for a `<select>` element.
It displays as a button and flips between different options.

    <catalyst-flip-button>
      <select>
        <option>Apples</option>
        <option>Banana</option>
        <option>Carrot</option>
        <option>Duck</option>
      </select>
    </catalyst-flip-button>

### Focus
To focus a catalyst-flip-button, you can call the native `focus()` method as long as the
element has a tab index. Similarly, `blur()` will blur the element.

### Styling

The following css custom properties are available for this element:

Property | Description | Default Value
-------- |------------ | -------------
`--catalyst-flip-button-card-face-appearance`      | The appearance of the card face.            | `button`
`--catalyst-flip-button-card-face-background`      | The background of the card face.            | `#dddddd`
`--catalyst-flip-button-card-face-border`          | The border applied to the card face.        |
`--catalyst-flip-button-card-face-border-radius`   | The border radius applied to the card face. |
`--catalyst-flip-button-card-face-focused-outline` | The outline of the card face when focused.  |

properties.name: _cardFrontFace
properties.description: The front face of the card.

properties.name: _cardBackFace
properties.description: The back face of the card.

properties.name: _flipped
properties.description: True if the card has been flipped, otherwise false.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: States whether or not this element is disabled.

properties.name: noAutoPerspective
properties.description: States whether or not this element should automatically calculate its own perspective value.

methods.name: connectedCallback
methods.description: Fires when the element is inserted into the DOM.

methods.name: _upgradeProperty
methods.description:
Upgrade the property on this element with the given name.

A user may set a property on an _instance_ of an element before its prototype has been connected to this class.
This method will check for any instance properties and run them through the proper class setters.

See the [lazy properties](/web/fundamentals/architecture/building-components/best-practices#lazy-properties) section for more details.

methods.name: _setUpSelectElement
methods.description: Find the new form element and set it up.

methods.name: _setUpDimensions
methods.description:
Set the dimensions of this element.

This element cannot obtain it's dimensions automatically from it's children
as they are positioned absolutely. This method will manually calculate the
minimum size this component should be to contain its children.

methods.name: disconnectedCallback
methods.description: Fires when the element is removed from the DOM.

methods.name: attributeChangedCallback
methods.description: Fired when any of the attributes in the `observedAttributes` array change.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the attribute that changed.

params.name: oldValue
params.description: The original value of the attribute that changed.

params.name: newValue
params.description: The new value of the attribute that changed.

methods.name: _onKeyDown
methods.description: Called when a key is pressed on this element.

methods.name: _onClick
methods.description: Called when this element is clicked.

methods.name: _onMouseUp
methods.description: Called on the mouse up event.

methods.name: _onLeftClick
methods.description: Called when this element is left clicked.

methods.name: _onRightClick
methods.description: Called when this element is right clicked.

methods.name: notifySelectedOptionChanged
methods.description:
Notify this component that the select element has changed.

Must be called after manually setting the selected index.

methods.name: _onLightDomMutation
methods.description: Called when a top level lightDom mutation happens.

methods.name: _onOptionsMutation
methods.description: Called when a top level lightDom mutation happens.

methods.name: next
methods.description: Flip the button forwards to the next option.

methods.name: previous
methods.description: Flip the button back to the previous option.

methods.name: _flip
methods.description:
Flip the button.

This method is only caused by a user action, so it will dispatch a change event.

methods.name: _update
methods.description: Update the element

methods.name: _generateGuid
methods.description: Generate a guid (or at least something that seems like one)

elements.name: CatalystFlipButton

elements.description:
`<catalyst-toggle-button>` is a toggle button web component.

    <catalyst-toggle-button>Button</catalyst-toggle-button>

It may include optional form control setting for use in a form.

    <catalyst-toggle-button name="form-element-name" value="value">Button</catalyst-toggle-button>

### Focus
To focus a catalyst-toggle-button, you can call the native `focus()` method as long as the
element has a tab index. Similarly, `blur()` will blur the element.

### Styling

Style this element using native css properties; there are no custom properties available for this component.

methods.name: connectedCallback
methods.description: Fires when the element is inserted into the DOM.

elements.name: CatalystToggleButton

elements.description:
`<catalyst-toggle-switch>` is a toggle switch web component.

    <catalyst-toggle-switch></catalyst-toggle-switch>

It may include optional form control setting for use in a form.

    <catalyst-toggle-switch name="form-element-name" value="value"></catalyst-toggle-switch>

### Focus
To focus a catalyst-toggle-switch, you can call the native `focus()` method as long as the
element has a tab index. Similarly, `blur()` will blur the element.

### Styling

The following css custom properties are available for this element:

Property | Description | Default Value
-------- |------------ | -------------
`--catalyst-toggle-switch-bar-color`       | The color of the bar.                      | `#ced4da`
`--catalyst-toggle-switch-knob-color`      | The color of the knob.                     | `#ffffff`
`--catalyst-toggle-switch-bar-width`       | The width of the bar.                      | `44px`
`--catalyst-toggle-switch-bar-height`      | The height of the bar.                     | `16px`
`--catalyst-toggle-switch-knob-size`       | The size of the knob (width and height).   | `26px`
`--catalyst-toggle-switch-knob-offset`     | The offset applied to the knob's location. | `5px`
`--catalyst-toggle-switch-bar-border`      | The bar's border.                          | `none`
`--catalyst-toggle-switch-knob-border`     | The knob's border.                         | `none`
`--catalyst-toggle-switch-knob-box-shadow` | The box shadow applied to the knob.        | _Too Long..._

methods.name: connectedCallback
methods.description: Fires when the element is inserted into the DOM.

methods.name: styleUpdated
methods.description: Should be called after changing the element's style.

elements.name: CatalystToggleSwitch

properties.name: checked
properties.description: States whether or not this element is checked.

properties.name: pressed
properties.description: States whether or not this element is pressed.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: States whether or not this element is disabled.

properties.name: required
properties.description: States whether or not this element is required.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this element. Used for forms.

properties.name: form
properties.description: The form this element is apart of.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value this element has. Used for forms.

methods.name: connectedCallback
methods.description: Fires when the element is inserted into the DOM.

methods.name: _upgradeProperty
methods.description:
Upgrade the property on this element with the given name.

A user may set a property on an _instance_ of an element before its prototype has been connected to this class.
This method will check for any instance properties and run them through the proper class setters.

See the [lazy properties](/web/fundamentals/architecture/building-components/best-practices#lazy-properties) section for more details.

methods.name: setUpLabels
methods.description: Updated the labels for this element.

methods.name: disconnectedCallback
methods.description: Fires when the element is removed from the DOM.

methods.name: attributeChangedCallback
methods.description: Fired when any of the attributes in the `observedAttributes` array change.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the attribute that changed.

params.name: oldValue
params.description: The original value of the attribute that changed.

params.name: newValue
params.description: The new value of the attribute that changed.

methods.name: _onKeyDown
methods.description: Called when a key is pressed on this element.

methods.name: _onClick
methods.description: Called when this element is clicked.

methods.name: _onLabelClick
methods.description: Called when a label of this element is clicked.

methods.name: _toggleChecked
methods.description:
`_toggleChecked()` calls the either the `checked` or `pressed` setter and flips its state.
Because `_toggleChecked()` is only caused by a user action, it will
also dispatch a change event.

methods.name: _generateGuid
methods.description: Generate a guid (or at least something that seems like one)

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the component's `pressed` value changes due to user interaction.
